Big Word Bubbles.definition: Word tactics that create tall and wide message bubbles when sent in-game. They are said to "use up a lot of space" or "cover".

Club Penguin Armies.definition: An army organization (abbreviated "CPA") that organizes tournaments, releases top ten rankings, provide media, recognizes wars, and much more. They are a consortium of departments and the Army Board that work collectively for the army community.

Club Penguin Army Judges.definition: An army organization (abbreviated "CPAJ") that oversees and judges battles. They are a consortium of army leagues and judges.

Club Penguin Journey.definition: CP Journey (CPJ) is a modern, popular Club Penguin private server.

Club Penguin Private Servers.definition: A Club Penguin private server (CPPS), such as CPAB or CPJ, is a replica of the original Club Penguin game that ran until 2017.

Map server.definition: A server, or territory, is a specific area on the army map. It can be owned by an army or be neutral.

Recruit.definition: A new member who has joined the army but has not yet been verified. They have limited access to army channels and activities.

Staff-in-Training.definition: A candidate who is undergoing training before becoming a full staff member. They have limited staff privileges.

Visitor.definition: An individual affiliated with another Club Penguin army, or an unaffiliated Club Penguin army veteran.

Troop-stealing.definition: An unethical, widely-condemned practice where one army or individual attempts to recruit members already enlisted in another army.
